info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 6:50AM EDT until April 7 at 6:31PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers...
Great Miami River at Franklin.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Great Miami River at Franklin.
* WHEN...From this evening to Monday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, In addition to flooding onto low areas of Oxford Road near the railway bridge, water floods basements of riverside apartments along Dayton-Oxford Road. Water extends nearly to Dayton-Oxford Road itself in Chautauqua in Warren County on the west bank and onto North Dixie Highway on the east bank. Areas of Franklin protected by Miami Conservancy District Levees do not flood until stages at and above 22 feet.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 15.9 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/iln.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO MONDAY EVENING
